title: Need Help ID'ing this front.
content:
Hey,

If someone could please help with the identification of these characters, it would mean a lot to me.  
Also where to get the front if it isn't in MS Office would be great if possible.

Thanks,  
0

Font: 

 Helvetica (Light) 

Solved By: 

 [fvilanakis](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317112822/http:/typophile.com/user/176276 "View user profile.")

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Untitledee.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317112822/http:/typophile.com/files/Untitledee.png) | 52.14 KB |
author: 0lzerol0

comments.content:
Your font seems to be **[Helvetica (Light)](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317112822/http:/www.findmyfont.com/index.php/fonts/font-preview?fset=Linotype&ffam=Helvetica%20-%20Light&fid=459f7afe1ead878da5d61ee98f542c03&fsize=60&text=ABFDGMacdegimnohust&wrap=2)**  
Microsoft has actually copied and modified Helvetica to create Arial which is the closest alternative included in MS-Office.  
You can buy Helvetica here:  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/search/Helvetica/fonts/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317112822/http:/www.myfonts.com/search/Helvetica/fonts/ "http://www.myfonts.com/search/Helvetica/fonts/")
fvilanakis Thank you for the quick reply.
